com.flamingOctoIronman.framework.event

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flamingOctoIronman.framework.event.Event
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoreEvent, InputEvent

    public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the framework for all events. It provides methods to subscribe, unsubscribe, and publish events.
    Author:
    Quint
    See Also:
    CoreEvent

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Verbosity level
      If Verbosity.MEDIUM or Verbosity.HIGH A line will be added to the output whenever a subscribed method is called.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.reflect.Method> methodList
      Holds a list of methods that will be called on the event
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> objectList
      Holds a list of objects to call the above methods on
      private StreamManager streams
      This reference is to make it easier to access the stream manager.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event()
      Creates a new event

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean compareNames(java.lang.reflect.Method m)
      Compares the name of the class to the annotation on the passed method.
      abstract java.lang.String getName()
      Calls Class.getSimpleName() on the class.
      Verbosity getVerbosity()
      Returns the verbosity of the Event
      void publish()
      Publishes the event to all subscribers.
      void setVerbosity(Verbosity level)
      Sets the verbosity of the Event
      void subscribe(java.lang.reflect.Method subscriberMethod, java.lang.Object subscriberObject)
      Subscribes the Method and it's respective Object to the event.
      void unsubscribe(java.lang.Object subscriberObject, java.lang.reflect.Method subscriberMethod)
      Removes the Object and it's Method from the list.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Holds a list of objects to call the above methods on

        private Verbosity level
        If Verbosity.MEDIUM or Verbosity.HIGH A line will be added to the output whenever a subscribed method is called.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event()

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(java.lang.reflect.Method subscriberMethod,
             java.lang.Object subscriberObject)
        Subscribes the Method and it's respective Object to the event.
        Parameters:
        subscriberMethod - The Method to subscribe
        subscriberObject - The Object to subscribe

      • publish

        public void publish()
             throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Publishes the event to all subscribers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Thrown if the Method is inaccessible
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the Method takes any arguments
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - Thrown if the subscribed Method can't be performed on it's Object

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(java.lang.Object subscriberObject,
               java.lang.reflect.Method subscriberMethod)
        Removes the Object and it's Method from the list. Warning: if the Object has more than one subscriber Method, the wrong subscriber Object could be removed.
        Parameters:
        subscriberObject - The Object to unsubscribe
        subscriberMethod - The Method to unsubscribe

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Calls Class.getSimpleName() on the class. Returns the simple name of the class.
        Returns:
        the simple name of the class.

      • compareNames

        public abstract boolean compareNames(java.lang.reflect.Method m)
        Compares the name of the class to the annotation on the passed method.
        Parameters:
        m - The Method to compare
        Returns:
        True if the name of the class is the same as the method's annotation, otherwise false

      • getVerbosity

        public Verbosity getVerbosity()
        Returns the verbosity of the Event
        Returns:
        the Verbosity of the Event

      • setVerbosity

        public void setVerbosity(Verbosity level)
        Sets the verbosity of the Event
        Parameters:
        level - the Verbosity level to set the Event to
